abstracts.cdata!:
This document examines the principal
            environmental and social aspects of the Eastern Indonesia
            Region Transport Priorities Analysis and will form the basis
            of the environmental management plan for all sub-projects
            within the project of the same name. The EMP covers the
            followig aspects: environmental screening, stakeholder
            consultation, resettlement and treatment of all affected
            stakeholders, acquisition and compensation for land and
            buildings, treatment of isolated peoples, monitoring of
            impacts and of EMP implementation, and institutional
            responsibilities and recommendations. Some of the procedures
            adopted concerning the development of roads and bridges in
            the vicinity of "isolated vulnerable peoples"
            include keeping land acquisition to a minimum, providing
            social workers and/or nongovernmental organizations to
            assist, considering "special mitigation" if a road
            passed in close proximity to traditional housing areas,
            providing training and/or funds for training for those
            people wanting to gain new skills to establish small-scale
            enterprise or to take up newly created job opportunities,
            and providing the services of a lawyer/expert to assist with
            land tenure/adat land-related problems, including the sale
            of their land. During construction the contractor would meet
            with community leaders to discuss the contractor's work
            schedule/program and any potential problems; and job
            opprtunities and training will ensure that inhabitants can
            actively participate in the road development.
